solution_line_template: 5 M&M candies make one unit so {total_m_and_m} makes {total_m_and_m}/{m_and_m_per_unit} = <<{total_m_and_m}/{m_and_m_per_unit}={num_units_m_and_m}>>{num_units_m_and_m} units of M&M candies

For every unit of 5 M&M candies, there is a corresponding unit of {starbursts_per_unit} Starbursts candies so for {num_units_m_and_m} units of M&M, she has {num_units_m_and_m} units of {starbursts_per_unit} Starbursts candies which is = {num_units_m_and_m}*{starbursts_per_unit} = <<{num_units_m_and_m}*{starbursts_per_unit}={total_starbursts}>>{total_starbursts} Starbursts candies.
